de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class MaterialDialogBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.AlertDialog.Builder
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.MaterialDialogBuilder

  • public class MaterialDialogBuilder
extends android.app.AlertDialog.Builder
    A builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5.0's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices. Such a dialog consists of a title, a message and up to three buttons. Furthermore the dialog can be used to show list items. It is possible to customize the color of the dialog's title and button texts and the title as well as the dialog's content can be replaced by a custom view.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

      Defines the interface, a class, which should be able to validate the content of a dialog, must implement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaterialDialogBuilder

        public MaterialDialogBuilder(android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5.0's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • MaterialDialogBuilder

        public MaterialDialogBuilder(android.content.Context context,
                             int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which alows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5.0's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

        public final MaterialDialogBuilder stackButtons(boolean stackButtons)

        Parameters:
        stackButtons - True, if the buttons of the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be aligned vertically, false otherwise
